result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal M. Vergin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for both the Substance Abuse Program and the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, restitution and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.   Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 423, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

Defendant shall maintain full time employment, full time school or a combination.  Should defendant become unemployed he shall apply at 25 businesses/month that are hiring and file work search affidavits.;

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
